%md
# About
**Lab:** Hive Partitions
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive partitions
**File locations:** hostname:/tmp/movies  hdfs:///data/movies
**Successful outcome:** Understanding hive partitions
**Before you begin:** N/A
**Related lessons:** Hive Partitions and Bucketing 

---

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Setup

Run the `Reset` section in the [SETUP/Movie_DB](http://client02.cloudair.lan:9995/#/notebook/2FS89EYSM) notebook.

msg.data:
Setup

Run the Reset section in the SETUP/Movie_DB notebook.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Lab

msg.data: Lab

We are going to use the new movie database. You can do a describe on the tables.

USE movie;
DESCRIBE movie_title;
DESCRIBE movie_crew;
DESCRIBE movie_crew_info;
DESCRIBE rating;

Review the tables to determine keys to join.

paragraphs.title: 1 - Use movie database and create a join for  the movie_title_stage and rating_stage tables. Show the title type, primary title ,original title and average rating. Limit 5

paragraphs.title: 2 - Execute the Explain Plan on the Join statement
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
EXPLAIN SELECT movie_title_stage.titleType, movie_title_stage.primaryTitle, movie_title_stage.originalTitle, rating_stage.averageRting FROM movie_title_stage JOIN rating_stage ON (movie_title_stage.tconst=rating_stage.tconst) LIMIT 5;

msg.data:
Explain
Plan optimized by CBO.

Vertex dependency in root stage
Map 1 <- Map 2 (BROADCAST_EDGE)

Stage-0
  Fetch Operator
    limit:5
    Stage-1
      Map 1 vectorized, llap
      File Output Operator [FS_26]
        Limit [LIM_25] (rows=5 width=699)
          Number of rows:5
          Select Operator [SEL_24] (rows=2275675 width=699)
            Output:["_col0","_col1","_col2","_col3"]
            Map Join Operator [MAPJOIN_23] (rows=2275675 width=699)
              Conds:SEL_22._col0=RS_20._col0(Inner),Output:["_col1","_col2","_col3","_col5"]
            <-Map 2 [BROADCAST_EDGE] vectorized, llap
              BROADCAST [RS_20]
                PartitionCols:_col0
                Select Operator [SEL_19] (rows=602762 width=182)
                  Output:["_col0","_col1"]
                  Filter Operator [FIL_18] (rows=602762 width=182)
                    predicate:tconst is not null
                    TableScan [TS_3] (rows=634486 width=182)
                      movie@rating_stage,rating_stage,Tbl:COMPLETE,Col:NONE,Output:["tconst","averagerting"]
            <-Select Operator [SEL_22] (rows=2068796 width=699)
                Output:["_col0","_col1","_col2","_col3"]
                Filter Operator [FIL_21] (rows=2068796 width=699)
                  predicate:tconst is not null
                  TableScan [TS_0] (rows=2177679 width=699)
                    movie@movie_title_stage,movie_title_stage,Tbl:COMPLETE,Col:NONE,Output:["tconst","titletype","primarytitle","originaltitle"]

paragraphs.text:
%md
We are going to create a materialized view using a table join.

~~~console
Create a materialized view mv_movie_rating that joins tables movie_title and rating. 
Include only the movies that have a start year after 2001 and an average rating greater than 5.5. (Limit to 5 rows.) 
~~~

But first we need to drop the materialized view if it already exists.

msg.data:
We are going to create a materialized view using a table join.

Create a materialized view mv_movie_rating that joins tables movie_title and rating. 
Include only the movies that have a start year after 2001 and an average rating greater than 5.5. (Limit to 5 rows.)

But first we need to drop the materialized view if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 5 - Drop the materialized view if exist
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP MATERIALIZED VIEW IF EXISTS movies.mv_movie_rating;

msg.data: Query executed successfully. Affected rows : -1

paragraphs.title: 6 - Create the materialized view
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW IF NOT EXISTS movie.mv_movie_rating AS SELECT movie_title_stage.titleType, movie_title_stage.primaryTitle, movie_title_stage.originalTitle, rating_stage.averageRting from movie_title_stage JOIN rating_stage ON (movie_title_stage.tconst=rating_stage.tconst) where movie_title_stage.startYear> 2001 and rating_stage.averageRting >5.5;

msg.data: Query executed successfully. Affected rows : -1

paragraphs.title: 7 - Execute a Query on the materialized view. Limit 5
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
SELECT * FROM movie.mv_movie_rating LIMIT 5;

Explain

Vertex dependency in root stage
Map 1 <- Map 2 (BROADCAST_EDGE)

Stage-0
  Fetch Operator
    limit:5
    Stage-1
      Map 1 vectorized, llap

              Conds:SEL_22._col0=RS_20._col0(Inner),Output:["_col1","_col2","_col3","_col5"]

                    predicate:tconst is not null
                    TableScan [TS_3] (rows=629785 width=182)
                      movies@ratings_stage,ratings_stage,Tbl:COMPLETE,Col:NONE,Output:["tconst","averagerting"]

                Output:["_col0","_col1","_col2","_col3"]
